intro: Melanthera aspera var. canescens, commonly known as the rough-haired melanthemium, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
